title: China Eximbank provides preferential buyer's credit for Tire Plant Project in Angren Special Economic Zone
description: In August 2014, China Poly Group Corporation Limited signed a contract with Uzbekistan National Chemical Company to oversee the engineering, procurement, and construction of a $213.9 million tire plant in the Angren Special Economic Zone. This project was partially funded by a $156.37 million preferential buyer's credit (PBC) from China Eximbank to Asaka Bank (a majority state-owned commercial bank in Uzbekistan) and Birinchi Rezinotexnika Zavodi LLC (a special purpose vehicle and wholly-owned subsidiary of the Government of Uzbekistan). The PBC, which is captured via Project ID#54149, carried the following borrowing terms: a 20-year maturity, a 5-year grace period, and a 2% interest rate. The Government of Uzbekistan issued a sovereign guarantee for this loan.  The project was reportedly financed according to a debt-equity ratio of about 70:30, with China Eximbank funding the debt portion. The Fund for Reconstruction and Development of Uzbekistan, O'zimyosanoat, O'zavtosanoat, the Navoi Mining and Smelting Plant, and Almalyk Mining and Smelting Plant reportedly funded the equity portion, although the breakdown of the $57.53 million equity portion is unknown.   The purpose of the project was to construct a tire plant — known as the Birinchi Rubber Engineering Plant (BRZ) — in Angren Special Economic Zone. Upon completion, the plant's production capacity was originally expected to be 3 million car tires, 200,000 agricultural tires, and 100,000 linear meters of conveyor belts for cleaning equipment per year.   China Poly Group Corporation Limited and CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. were the contractors responsible for project implementation. All production equipment and processes were sourced from China. Construction began on August 28, 2015 and was expected to last 34 months. The first tire was produced on trial on September 1, 2017, and production gradually increased during the end of 2017. The project was officially completed on July 25, 2018.   However, the tire plant and the loan that supported its construction underperformed vis-a-vis their original expectations. In 2020, the Government of Uzbekistan provided an emergency loan worth 40 billion soums (about $4 million) — through its Anti-Crisis Fund — to keep the tire plant financially afloat. Then, in September 2021, the Deputy Speaker of the Legislative Chamber of Oliy Majlis, Alisher Kadyrov, revealed that the tire plant was only operating at 15% capacity. On January 20, 2023, Uzkimyosanoat JSC signed an agreement to sell a 100% equity stake in the tire plant to Tatneft of Russia for 826.57 billion soums.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 了乌兹别克斯坦安格连橡胶厂项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Eximbank provides preferential buyer's credit for Tire Plant Project in Angren Special Economic Zone

# Description
In August 2014, China Poly Group Corporation Limited signed a contract with Uzbekistan National Chemical Company to oversee the engineering, procurement, and construction of a $213.9 million tire plant in the Angren Special Economic Zone. This project was partially funded by a $156.37 million preferential buyer's credit (PBC) from China Eximbank to Asaka Bank (a majority state-owned commercial bank in Uzbekistan) and Birinchi Rezinotexnika Zavodi LLC (a special purpose vehicle and wholly-owned subsidiary of the Government of Uzbekistan). The PBC, which is captured via Project ID#54149, carried the following borrowing terms: a 20-year maturity, a 5-year grace period, and a 2% interest rate. The Government of Uzbekistan issued a sovereign guarantee for this loan.  The project was reportedly financed according to a debt-equity ratio of about 70:30, with China Eximbank funding the debt portion. The Fund for Reconstruction and Development of Uzbekistan, O'zimyosanoat, O'zavtosanoat, the Navoi Mining and Smelting Plant, and Almalyk Mining and Smelting Plant reportedly funded the equity portion, although the breakdown of the $57.53 million equity portion is unknown.   The purpose of the project was to construct a tire plant — known as the Birinchi Rubber Engineering Plant (BRZ) — in Angren Special Economic Zone. Upon completion, the plant's production capacity was originally expected to be 3 million car tires, 200,000 agricultural tires, and 100,000 linear meters of conveyor belts for cleaning equipment per year.   China Poly Group Corporation Limited and CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. were the contractors responsible for project implementation. All production equipment and processes were sourced from China. Construction began on August 28, 2015 and was expected to last 34 months. The first tire was produced on trial on September 1, 2017, and production gradually increased during the end of 2017. The project was officially completed on July 25, 2018.   However, the tire plant and the loan that supported its construction underperformed vis-a-vis their original expectations. In 2020, the Government of Uzbekistan provided an emergency loan worth 40 billion soums (about $4 million) — through its Anti-Crisis Fund — to keep the tire plant financially afloat. Then, in September 2021, the Deputy Speaker of the Legislative Chamber of Oliy Majlis, Alisher Kadyrov, revealed that the tire plant was only operating at 15% capacity. On January 20, 2023, Uzkimyosanoat JSC signed an agreement to sell a 100% equity stake in the tire plant to Tatneft of Russia for 826.57 billion soums.
justification: The project is focused on tire manufacturing without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of a tire plant producing car tires, agricultural tires, and conveyor belts

title: Chinese Government provides $20 million grant for acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats (Linked to Project ID#40111)
description: On March 11, 2014, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed an agreement to grant $20 million USD to Uzbekistan for the acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats. The purpose of this project was to improve the irrigation system and to increase water availability and productivity of land in Uzbekistan. In total, 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats were delivered to Uzbekistan under this project. Project implementation facilities are located in Karakalpakstan, Khorezm, Bukhara and Kashkadarya regions. This project was completed on October 10, 2018.
staff_comments: The Russian project name is  'Поставка земснарядов и комплектующих лодок в Узбекистан за счет грантовых средств правительства КНР”. This project is linked to Phase I of the Amu Darya (Amudarya) river clean up (captured in #40111).
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides $20 million grant for acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats (Linked to Project ID#40111)

# Description
On March 11, 2014, the Chinese Government and the Government of Uzbekistan signed an agreement to grant $20 million USD to Uzbekistan for the acquisition of 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats. The purpose of this project was to improve the irrigation system and to increase water availability and productivity of land in Uzbekistan. In total, 20 dredgers and 2 towing boats were delivered to Uzbekistan under this project. Project implementation facilities are located in Karakalpakstan, Khorezm, Bukhara and Kashkadarya regions. This project was completed on October 10, 2018.
justification: Project focuses on water supply and irrigation infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Acquisition of dredgers and towing boats for irrigation system improvement, water availability focus

title: China Eximbank loans $61.69 million to Uzbektelecom for National Telecom Network Project
description: In 2014, China Eximbank loaned $61.69 million to Uzbektelecom (a state-owned telecommunications operator) for National Telecom Network Project in Uzbekistan. This project will expand the broadband backbone network to regional centers in Uzbekistan.  The project will be implemented to increase reliability and vitality of telecommunication network and expand its capacity up to 100 Gbps. The project will seek to install data transfer equipment based on DWDM/SDH/IP/MPLS technologies. It is also planned to install OTN technology to full reservation of existing transport network of Uzbektelecom.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 乌兹别克斯坦电信全国网项目. Loan details are unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
China Eximbank loans $61.69 million to Uzbektelecom for National Telecom Network Project

# Description
In 2014, China Eximbank loaned $61.69 million to Uzbektelecom (a state-owned telecommunications operator) for National Telecom Network Project in Uzbekistan. This project will expand the broadband backbone network to regional centers in Uzbekistan.  The project will be implemented to increase reliability and vitality of telecommunication network and expand its capacity up to 100 Gbps. The project will seek to install data transfer equipment based on DWDM/SDH/IP/MPLS technologies. It is also planned to install OTN technology to full reservation of existing transport network of Uzbektelecom.
justification: Project focuses on telecommunications infrastructure without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Expansion of broadband network, installation of data transfer equipment, telecommunications focus

title: Chinese Government provides $25.5 million grant for provision of multimedia equipment to 1st-4th grade classrooms (Linked to Project ID#72571, #72568, #72567, #72569, #72570, and #72564)
description: On August 22, 2014, China agreed to allocate US$25,539,000 to the Uzbekistan Ministry of Public Education for the provision of multimedia equipment for 1st to 4th grade classrooms. The donation money was utilized in two phases. During the first phase, 6,642 sets of equipment were purchased for $11,489,000, while 8,123 sets were purchased during phase two for $14,050,000. These sets of equipment were comprised of: 1 computer, 2 speakers, 1 optical mouse, 1 video projector, 1 interactive whiteboard, 1 TV tuner for computer equipment  The classroom upgrades seek to improve teacher proficiency in foreign language instruction in classrooms across the republic. The acquisition was part of a push by Uzbekistan to attract grant aid for its education system. It was reported that Uzbekistan attracted $225.6 million of grant aid for this purpose, some of which was provided by the People's Republic of China. As such, this project is linked to several other Chinese donations to the education sector during this timeframe: #72564 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 5th-9th #72568 for the purchase of 740 pieces of computer equipment for special needs students #72569 for the purchase of computer hardware and computer equipment.  #72570 for the equipping of children's centers "Barkamol Avlod" with 434 sets of computer equipment #72571 for the purchase of new stage equipment for the Republican Center for Children's Artistic Creativity #72567 for the purchase of new equipment for the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs (CDMEP)
staff_comments: News sources put this figure at $73,500,000 - this is the number for the aggregate grant for both grades 1-4 and 5-9, which we have split between two separate projects
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides $25.5 million grant for provision of multimedia equipment to 1st-4th grade classrooms (Linked to Project ID#72571, #72568, #72567, #72569, #72570, and #72564)

# Description
On August 22, 2014, China agreed to allocate US$25,539,000 to the Uzbekistan Ministry of Public Education for the provision of multimedia equipment for 1st to 4th grade classrooms. The donation money was utilized in two phases. During the first phase, 6,642 sets of equipment were purchased for $11,489,000, while 8,123 sets were purchased during phase two for $14,050,000. These sets of equipment were comprised of: 1 computer, 2 speakers, 1 optical mouse, 1 video projector, 1 interactive whiteboard, 1 TV tuner for computer equipment  The classroom upgrades seek to improve teacher proficiency in foreign language instruction in classrooms across the republic. The acquisition was part of a push by Uzbekistan to attract grant aid for its education system. It was reported that Uzbekistan attracted $225.6 million of grant aid for this purpose, some of which was provided by the People's Republic of China. As such, this project is linked to several other Chinese donations to the education sector during this timeframe: #72564 for the allocation of multimedia packages to classrooms grades 5th-9th #72568 for the purchase of 740 pieces of computer equipment for special needs students #72569 for the purchase of computer hardware and computer equipment.  #72570 for the equipping of children's centers "Barkamol Avlod" with 434 sets of computer equipment #72571 for the purchase of new stage equipment for the Republican Center for Children's Artistic Creativity #72567 for the purchase of new equipment for the Center for the Development of Multimedia General Education Programs (CDMEP)
justification: Project focuses on education sector improvements without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Provision of multimedia equipment for classrooms, focus on education system upgrades

title: China Eximbank provides $5.04 million loan for Kenimeh-1 Pumping Station Reconstruction Project
description: On May 6, 2014, China Eximbank and National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $5.0407 million loan agreement for the Kenimeh-1 Pumping Station Reconstruction Project. The terms of this loan are as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, and 2.2% interest rate. This project is located in the Navoi region in Uzbekistan. The total project cost was $5.306 million USD, with the Uzbek Government financing the remaining costs.  China National Electric Engineering Co., Ltd is the contractor responsible for project implementation.
staff_comments: The Russian project title is «Реконструкция насосной станции «Кенимех-1» в Навоийской области».
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Eximbank provides $5.04 million loan for Kenimeh-1 Pumping Station Reconstruction Project

# Description
On May 6, 2014, China Eximbank and National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $5.0407 million loan agreement for the Kenimeh-1 Pumping Station Reconstruction Project. The terms of this loan are as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, and 2.2% interest rate. This project is located in the Navoi region in Uzbekistan. The total project cost was $5.306 million USD, with the Uzbek Government financing the remaining costs.  China National Electric Engineering Co., Ltd is the contractor responsible for project implementation.
justification: Project involves reconstruction of a pumping station without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Pumping station reconstruction, no specific energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China Eximbank loans $4.18 million for the Reconstruction of the Kasaba Pumping Station Project
description: In 2014, China Eximbank provided the National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan with a $4.18 million loan for the Reconstruction of the Kasaba Pumping Station Project. The terms of the loan are as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period. 2% interest rate.  China IPPR International Engineering Co., Ltd. is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The implementation period of the project is three years (2014-2016). The purpose of this project is to irrigate agricultural crops within the Navoi Region.
staff_comments: The Russian project title is Реконструкция насосной станции «Касаба» в Навоийской области.
combined_text:
# Sector

The terms of the loan are as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period. 2% interest rate.  China IPPR International Engineering Co., Ltd. is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The implementation period of the project is three years (2014-2016). The purpose of this project is to irrigate agricultural crops within the Navoi Region.
justification: Project focuses on water supply for agricultural irrigation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Reconstruction of pumping station for agricultural irrigation, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China Eximbank provides $4.3 million loan for Raish Khakent-2 Pumping Station Project (linked to #54517)
description: In 2014, China Eximbank provides the National Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of the Republic of Uzbekistan with $4.3 million for the Raish Khakent-2 Pumping Station Project. The purpose of this project is to irrigate agricultural crops within the Andijan Region.   This project is linked to a loan for Raish Khakent-1 in 2008 (captured in #54517).

title: Chinese Government grants $4 million for the supply and installation of medical oxygen generators
description: In 2014, Chinese Government provided a $4 million grant for the supply and installation of medical oxygen generators for large hospitals in Uzbekistan. The project provided the supply and installation of 40 medical oxygen generators. The Ministry of Health of Uzbekistan was responsible for the project.
staff_comments: The Russian project title is Поставка и инсталляция генераторов медицинского кислорода для крупных больниц.

title: Chinese Government grants $3 million for Phase 1 of 3,000-bed equipment project (Linked to Project ID#72180)
description: In 2014, the Chinese government provided a $3 million grant for Phase 1 of a project to equip Uzbek medical institutions with 3,000 beds. Within the framework of this project, it was envisaged to supply 3,000 functional beds for equipping medical institutions in Uzbekistan, especially institutions for socially significant diseases (psychiatry, tuberculosis, narcology). The Uzbek Ministry of Health was responsible for the project.
staff_comments: The Russian title of the project is Оснащение функциональными кроватями медицинских учреждений республики. Фаза 1. Phase II of this project is captured in #72180.
